46:15 Caption: The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
46:59 Caption: We can hope that the managers will be able to motivate the players and stir them to improve their performance for after the half-time break. We haven't seen really exciting football in the previous 45 minutes. Even first half from both sides, and they've both had chances. The home team tries to find the weakness in the opposition's defence, especially with rapid counter-attacks, while the away team play possession football.

43:40 Event: Direct free-kick by Southampton

44:05 Caption: What a chance that is! Graziano Pelle (Southampton) squanders a huge opportunity as he latches on to a perfect cross from the wing. He produces a bullet header from around the penalty spot which goes well wide of the right post!
44:17 Event: Clearance by Manchester
44:48 Event: Ball out of play
44:55 Caption: Morgan Schneiderlin (Manchester United) goes on a solo run, but he fails to create a chance as an opposition player blocks him. The ball goes out of play. Manchester Utd are awarded a corner kick.
45:22 Caption: Memphis Depay (Manchester United) rolls the ball short to a teammate from the corner instead of sending a cross into the box.
45:37 Caption: Flag goes up against Memphis Depay (Manchester United) and the referee blows his whistle for offside.
46:06 Caption: Dusan Tadic (Southampton) blows a huge opportunity! He latches on to a perfect cross from the wing into the penalty area, but sends a bullet header just wide of the left post!
46:58 Caption: Victor Wanyama (Southampton) shoots after his astonishing individual effort from about 18 metres out to the top left corner, but David de Gea shows his excellent skills and saves the attempt. Southampton get a corner.
47:30 Caption: Dusan Tadic (Southampton) will deliver the ball into the penalty box from a corner kick.
48:32 Caption: Steven Davis (Southampton) meets a cross on the edge of the box and produces a header towards the bottom right corner, but one of the defending players blocks the effort.
49:04 Caption: Victor Wanyama (Southampton) collects a rebound and produces a mid-range attempt. The ball goes low to the middle of the target, but David de Gea keeps it out.
49:33 Caption: Memphis Depay (Manchester United) makes a strong challenge and Mark Clattenburg blows for a foul.
50:13 Caption: The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
50:59 Caption: It was a very watchable match. Great goals and there was plenty of action at both ends of the pitch. No regrets about following this game. You have to say that the visitors have been the better side. Both sides adopted slow build-up play tactics today.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
In a thrilling Premier League clash that saw five goals and plenty of drama, Manchester United edged Southampton with a 3-2 victory at St Mary’s Stadium.

The match kicked off promptly with Southampton taking the first touch of the ball. They looked to establish dominance early on but saw the ball go out of play within the first minute. The hosts quickly resumed their play with a throw-in but committed a foul shortly thereafter. Manchester United took their first indirect free-kick of the game, hoping to capitalize on the early lapse from the Saints.

The initial minutes of the game were scrappy, with both sides struggling to maintain possession. Southampton had the first real opportunity with a shot that went off target, resulting in a Manchester United clearance. Just moments later, another indirect free-kick was awarded to Southampton after Manchester was penalized for yet another foul.

Southampton's attacking prowess came to the forefront as they continued to press forward. Around the 10-minute mark, they were given a corner, which Manchester United skillfully cleared. But the relentless Saints came close to finding the net when Sadio Mane placed a commanding lofted cross into the box. Although David de Gea made an incredible save to deny Mane's effort, Graziano Pelle was quick to pounce on the rebound, rifling the ball low inside the left post to give Southampton a 1-0 lead.

Manchester United sought to respond quickly, and although a wild shot from Anthony Martial went high over the bar, it was clear that the Red Devils were looking to make their mark on the game. Both teams exchanged clearances and throw-ins as Southampton tried to extend their lead while Manchester aimed to find an equalizer.

Southampton almost doubled their advantage when Pelle struck the ball against the right post, a near miss that kept Manchester United in the game. They were soon rewarded for their resilience when Anthony Martial received a killer pass and sent a low drive past the Southampton goalkeeper to level the score at 1-1 just before the halftime whistle.

The teams retreated to their dressing rooms with the scoreline even. Ronald Koeman and Louis van Gaal made tactical adjustments during the break. As the second half commenced, Southampton introduced Cuco Martina for Matt Targett, who appeared to have sustained an injury. Manchester United brought on Antonio Valencia for Matteo Darmian, seeking to inject fresh energy into their lineup.

The second half began as lively as the first, featuring a string of fouls and indirect free-kicks. An error from a Southampton defender allowed Anthony Martial to seize the ball and slot it home, giving Manchester United a 2-1 advantage. Martial's goal highlighted not just his finishing prowess but also his ability to capitalize on defensive lapses.

Southampton, spurred on by their home crowd, pushed forward but their efforts were stifled by a disciplined Manchester defense. James Ward-Prowse's attempts to deliver the ball into dangerous areas were constantly thwarted by the alert de Gea.

Southampton made additional changes, with Oriol Romeu being substituted by Steven Davis, aiming to bring a fresh burst of energy and creativity. Despite these substitutions, Manchester United extended their lead further. Memphis Depay showcased some brilliant play, skipping past defenders and hitting a strike that crashed against the post. The rebound fell kindly to Juan Manuel Mata, who smashed it inside the right post to make it 3-1.

With a comfortable lead, Manchester United made another substitution, bringing on Paddy McNair for Marcos Rojo. Southampton continued to search for a way back into the game, with Dusan Tadic swinging in corners and crosses, but David de Gea remained resolute, making crucial saves.

Southampton found a glimmer of hope when Graziano Pelle met a pinpoint cross with a towering header, reducing the deficit to 3-2. This instigated a frenzied period of play where Southampton threw everything forward in search of an equalizer. They came agonizingly close on a few occasions—Dusan Tadic and Victor Wanyama both had shots on target, but de Gea was equal to the task, denying them and maintaining Manchester's slender lead.

Despite Southampton's relentless pursuit, Manchester United managed to hold onto their lead. The game concluded after an intense period of injury time, where Manchester United's defense, well marshaled by de Gea, repelled Southampton’s advances. The referee blew the final whistle, sealing a hard-fought 3-2 victory for the Red Devils.

The final whistle brought an end to a highly watchable contest. Throughout the match, both teams presented variations in their playstyle—Manchester United's strategic possession-based approach often contrasted Southampton's rapid counter-attacks. Both sides generated numerous chances but Manchester United, albeit with a performance that was at times scrappy, managed to eke out the win thanks to their clinical finishing.

From the dramatic beginning with constant interruptions and fouls to the thrilling conclusion where Graziano Pelle's header brought hope to the fans of the Saints, it was a match that delivered excitement and memorable moments. Manchester United's resilience and de Gea’s crucial saves were pivotal, ensuring that they secured all three points in this exhilarating Premier League encounter.
